title: 108_hr2346
content: The "Seniors Financial Security Act of 2003" repeals the inclusion of Social Security benefits and Tier 1 Railroad Retirement benefits in gross income. The "Seniors Financial Security Act of 2003" repeals the taxation of social security and tier 1 railroad retirement benefits under Section 86 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Additionally, technical and conforming amendments are made to the treatment of workmen's compensation benefits under the Code. The workmen's compensation act is amended to define tier 1 railroad retirement benefits under the Internal Revenue Code. It specifies the annuity amount under the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 and includes service after December 31, 1936, in the definition of 'employment' for Social Security benefits. The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to remove certain sections from the Internal Revenue Code, including the taxation of social security benefits by nonresident aliens. Additionally, provisions related to social security benefits as United States sourced are repealed. The repeal of various sections from the Internal Revenue Code is outlined, including the taxation of social security benefits by nonresident aliens. Additionally, provisions related to withholding tax on nonresident aliens and returns concerning social security benefits are also repealed. The amendments made in section 72(r)(3), 6103(h), 6103(p), and 1113(k) of the Internal Revenue Code are outlined. Changes to the tables of sections for specific parts of the Code are also mentioned. These amendments will apply to benefits received after December 31, 2002, in taxable years ending after that date. The amendments made in section 72(r)(3), 6103(h), 6103(p), and 1113(k) of the Internal Revenue Code will apply to benefits received after December 31, 2002, in taxable years ending after that date. Trust funds under the Social Security Act or the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 will be appropriated an amount equal to the reduction in transfers by reason of these amendments.
